page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: {Winchester Railway Station}on the Bournemouth to Waterloo line uses modern technology although it is small and old. The signals are computerised and the third rail is electrified.The lines are being welded together to prevent the familiar clicking sound. The station is grubby but British Rail is spending Â£64000 to improve it. Two platforms, each 342m., allow for long commuter trains. The station handles 5000 passengers a day, most popular destination being London(110km) Southampton (19km). The busiest times are Saturdays in the football season. A franchised{Garage}sold 600 new cars, 1984, 60% to firms 40% private. 350 used also sold. Many people change cars in August. Frequent{bus}services to town centre quite well used. Two car families probably contribute to traffic jams and parking difficulties.
